If you want to use chronograph on an older version of Django, here are some tips from nathforge.

Updated chronograph/views.py like so:

{{{
from django.contrib import admin
from django.contrib.auth.decorators import user_passes_test
from admin import JobAdmin
from models import Job

def job_run(request, pk):
    return JobAdmin(Job, admin.site).run_job_view(request, pk)

job_run = user_passes_test(lambda user: user.is_superuser)(job_run)
}}}

And a new pattern in your project's urls.py:

{{{
url(r'^admin/chronograph/job/(?P<pk>\d+)/run/$',
'chronograph.views.job_run', name="admin_chronograph_job_run")
}}}
